Package utility

Class GuiUtil

java.lang.Object
utility.GuiUtil
public final class GuiUtil extends Object
Contains helper functions for changing scenes and displaying dialog boxes to user.

Use for easier maintenance of code instead of code duplication

Version:
2022.06.30
Author:
Joseph Curtis

  • Method Details

    • newStage

      public static void newStage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, DataTransferObject user, String fxmlFileName, String windowTitle, javafx.stage.Modality modality) throws IOException
      Opens a new window for add appointments or customers
      Parameters:
      event - the user generated event (a button being clicked) that caused this to execute
      user - the currently logged-in user
      fxmlFileName - the .fxml file holding the next scene
      windowTitle - the new window title to set
      modality - mode for new window (NONE=unlocked, WINDOW_MODAL=locked to new window)
      Throws:
      IOException - if .fxml filename cannot be found

    • newStage

      public static void newStage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, DataTransferObject user, String fxmlFileName, String windowTitle, javafx.stage.Modality modality, ResourceBundle resources) throws IOException
      Opens a new stage (window). This is used to get the primary window.
      Parameters:
      event - the user generated event (a button being clicked) that caused this to execute
      user - the currently logged-in user
      fxmlFileName - the .fxml file holding the next scene
      windowTitle - the new window title to set
      modality - mode for new window (NONE=unlocked, WINDOW_MODAL=locked to new window)
      resources - the resource bundle (like language pack) that goes with the stage
      Throws:
      IOException - if .fxml filename cannot be found

    • newStage

      public static void newStage(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, DataTransferObject passedObject, DataTransferObject user, String fxmlFileName, String windowTitle, javafx.stage.Modality modality) throws IOException
      Opens a new window for modify appointments or customers
      Parameters:
      event - the user generated event (a button being clicked) that caused this to execute
      passedObject - the existing database object to modify, or null
      user - the currently logged-in user
      fxmlFileName - the .fxml file holding the next scene
      windowTitle - the new window title to set
      modality - mode for new window (NONE=unlocked, WINDOW_MODAL=locked to new window)
      Throws:
      IOException - if .fxml filename cannot be found

    • newStage

      user - the currently logged-in user
      fxmlFileName - the .fxml file holding the next scene
      windowTitle - the new window title to set
      modality - mode for new window (NONE=unlocked, WINDOW_MODAL=locked to new window)
      resources - the resource bundle (like language pack) that goes with the stage
      Throws:
      IOException - if .fxml filename cannot be found

    • showReport

      public static void showReport(String fxmlFileName, String windowTitle) throws IOException

      Parameters:
      fxmlFileName - the .fxml file holding the report scene
      windowTitle - the new window title to set
      Throws:
      IOException - if .fxml filename cannot be found

    • confirmExitApplication

      public static void confirmExitApplication()
      Quits the application. Displays a confirmation dialog before exiting.

      Uses lambdas to process the data stream when calling Alert.showAndWait() method. Here we use a lambda to filter the response, and one to check if response is present (user did not close window) before we exit the application.

    • showSettings

      public static boolean showSettings() throws IOException
      Show the change language settings dialog. This allows the user to override the system default language.
      Returns:
      true if language selection was made, false if cancel button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a Localization properties file cannot be found

    • showAbout

      public static void showAbout()
      Show the About this Application dialog box

    • confirmDeletion

      public static boolean confirmDeletion(String title, String header, String content, BooleanSupplier lambda)
      Displays a confirmation dialog for deleting Appointments or Customers.

      When the user confirms by clicking "OK", the lambda function will execute. If the lambda returns false, this indicates the delete operation was not successful. In this case an error dialog is shown.

      Using a lambda as a parameter here allows flexibility when calling this method. Different code can be executed depending on the return state of the lambda. In this case, since we are dealing with a Boolean Supplier, the state returned will be either true or false. Lambda is implemented during function call.

      Parameters:
      title - Dialog box window title
      header - Dialog box header text
      content - details within confirmation dialog box
      lambda - the operation to execute when the user clicks "OK"
      Returns:
      whether the deletion was successful or not (dependent on return state of lambda)

    • showAppointmentAlert

      public static void showAppointmentAlert(User user)
      Displays a dialog for each upcoming appointment.

      If the user has no appointments within 15 minutes, dialog shows no upcoming appointments.

      Here we convert the ObservableList collection of all users into a data stream for processing. We use a lambda to filter the data stream for upcoming appointments.

    • handleDataObjNotFoundException

      public static void handleDataObjNotFoundException(DataObjNotFoundException exception)
      Gives user an Error dialog box to warn of a serious problem with the database object. This should appear when there is concurrent activity writing to the database.
      Parameters:
      exception - thrown exception indicating the problem

    • handleBlankInputException

      public static void handleBlankInputException(BlankInputException exception)
      Pops up dialog box warning user of black input fields.
      Parameters:
      exception - indicator of a blank field that needs user input

    • handleLogicalError

      public static void handleLogicalError(InvalidInputException exception)
      Displays dialog box in response to a logical error (input validation).
      Parameters:
      exception - the logical error in question
